data.title: Dong-Kyun Ha - Grokipedia
data.snippet:
Ha Dong-kyun (Korean: 하동균; born June 28, 1980), known professionally as Ha Dong Qn, is a South Korean singer-songwriter known for his deep vocal timbre, wide range, and emotive ballad performances that have established him as a respected vocalist in the Korean music industry.   Born on June 28, 1980, in Seoul, he debuted in 2002 as a member of the short-lived vocal group 7Dayz before joining the boy band Wanted in 2004, where he has continued to perform despite intermittent hiatuses over the years.   His solo career began in 2006 with the release of the single album DQ from WANTED, followed by notable works including the studio albums Stand Alone (2006) and Another Corner (2008), as well as the EPs Mark (2012), Word (2014), and Polygon (2017).  Ha has further broadened his recognition [...] ## Early life

### Early years and background

Ha Dong-kyun was born on June 28, 1980, in Seoul, South Korea, specifically in the Jungnang-gu district (formerly part of Dongdaemun-gu).  His zodiac sign is Cancer, and he is Protestant Christian.  Early profiles list his height as 175 cm and blood type as O.  From childhood, Ha Dong-kyun developed a passion for music, particularly rock and heavy metal genres, listening to bands such as Whitesnake and Mr. Big while participating in rock bands during his youth.  These early experiences nurtured his dream of becoming a musician before his professional entry into the industry in 2002. 

## Career

### 2002–2005: Group debut with 7Dayz and Wanted [...] Polygon (2017).  Ha has further broadened his recognition through frequent appearances on major television music and variety programs, such as I Am a Singer Season 3, Immortal Songs: Singing the Legend, The Call Season 2, Begin Again, and Killing Voice, where his vocal prowess and interpretive skills have been widely praised.  He has also served as a vocal trainer on programs like MIXNINE and taken on radio DJ roles, contributing to his enduring presence in South Korea's entertainment landscape.  Currently signed to M.AR.K Planet, Ha remains active as a performer and collaborator in the industry.

data.title: Ha Dong-kyun - Grokipedia
data.snippet:
Ha Dong-kyun (Korean: 하동균; born June 28, 1980), professionally known as Ha Dong Qn, is a South Korean singer-songwriter recognized for his distinctive husky voice and emotive power ballads. Active in the K-pop industry for over two decades, he has built a career spanning group performances, solo releases, and television appearances, earning acclaim for his vocal depth and songwriting. Ha began his music career in 2002 as a member of the short-lived boy band 7Dayz, which disbanded shortly after debut. In 2004, he joined the YG Entertainment group Wanted, releasing their debut album before the group entered a three-year hiatus following the tragic death of member Seo Jae-hyo in a car accident. Transitioning to a solo path, Ha released his debut studio album Stand Alone in 2006, followed by [...] Ha Dong-kyun was born on June 28, 1980, in Jungnang-gu, Seoul, South Korea. Public information about his immediate family is limited, but he was raised by his parents alongside an older sister. This modest family background in a Seoul neighborhood appears to have fostered his relatable and grounded public persona, though specific details on his parents' occupations or home life are not widely documented. From a young age, Ha Dong-kyun showed an affinity for music, particularly rock, which he listened to avidly and even performed as a vocalist in a high school rock band—marking his initial forays into singing without any mention of formal training at that stage. These early local influences in Seoul helped shape his passion for music, setting the foundation for his later career pursuits. [...] ### Schooling and early interests

Ha Dong-kyun attended and graduated from Hansol High School in Gyeonggi Province. During his high school years, he participated in the rock band Sinabro as a vocalist, alongside fellow student and future bandmate Lee Jeong from 7Dayz, which helped cultivate his early passion for music. He developed an interest in rock music from a young age, frequently listening to rock bands and identifying as a "rock nerd." Prior to university, Ha Dong-kyun had no formal music education, instead honing his skills through self-directed practice and amateur involvement in school musical activities. He later graduated from Chungwoon University with a bachelor's degree in Broadcast Musicology and attended Kyung Hee University Graduate School.

## Career

data.title: Ha Dong-kyun - Wikipedia
data.snippet:
Ha Dong-kyun (Korean: 하동균; born June 28, 1980), officially known as Ha Dong Qn, is a South Korean singer-songwriter. He debuted in 2002 as a member of the short-lived boy band 7Dayz, before joining the boy band Wanted "Wanted (South Korean band)") in 2004. As a solo singer, he has released two albums: Stand Alone (2006) and Another Corner (2008), and three extended plays: Mark (2012), Word (2014), and Polygon (2017).
